definitions.definition: To walk or perform other actions while sleeping; to somnambulate .
To perform actions without being aware of them; to do something that invites certain results without confronting that possibility.
examples: The government is sleepwalking into a crisis.
They're trying to sleepwalk past their health problems.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To walk or perform other actions while sleeping; to somnambulate .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , figurative ) To perform actions without being aware of them; to do something that invites certain results without confronting that possibility.
